description: Only two games on Monday, and Olympians figured in both of them. Home teams listed first:

title: Kraft Offers Cadbury More Cash and Sells Unit to Nestl
description: Kraft said Tuesday that it would offer more cash in its $16 billion hostile takeover bid for the British chocolate maker Cadbury, using the proceeds from a $3.7 billion sale of its North American pizza unit to Nestl.

title: Percy Delivers Boises Most Confounding Trick Play
description: Boise States J.C. Percy was No. 48 in your Fiesta Bowl program, but youre forgiven if you missed him. Sure, he played in the No. 6 Broncos hard-fought 17-10 victory over No. 3 Texas Christian.

title: Talbots Amends Credit Facility Ahead of Deal
description: Talbots, the clothing retailer, said Monday it had amended its secured revolving loan agreement with shareholder Aeon to repay all of its outstanding third-party bank debt.

title: Whats Acceptable for Bank Returns?
description: What is an acceptable return on equity for a bank? That question is likely to dominate the debate among executives, investors and regulators in 2010, Reuters Breakingviews says.

title: Backer Settles Suit Over Crime Drama
description: The legal wrangling over the troubled crime drama Black Water Transit has taken another turn, with the films backer quietly settling a $3.1 million lawsuit brought by a producer on the eve of trial, Reuters reported.

title: Sumitomo Mitsui Said to Consider $8.7 Billion Share Sale
description: Sumitomo Mitsui Financial Group, Japans second-largest bank by market value, may announce plans this week to raise about 800 billion yen ($8.7 billion) in a share sale, two people familiar with the matter told Bloomberg News.

title: Class Time + Substitute = Waste?
description: According to a recent Op-Ed, more than 5% of teachers are absent on any given day, which means that by the time you finish high school, you have had substitutes for nearly a year of your schooling. And few substitutes are trained in either teaching or the curriculum they have to cover. What experiences have you had with substitutes?

title: Third Avenue Confirms Whitmans Role Change
description: Third Avenue Management confirmed Monday that Martin J. Whitman will relinquish his role as the firms co-chief investment officer.

title: International Aluminum Files For Chapter 11
description: International Aluminum Corporation, an American producer of aluminum and vinyl building products, filed for Chapter 11 bankruptcy protection late on Monday, hurt by a downturn in residential and commercial construction.

title: Bond Market Perks Up After Weak Finish in 09
description: Long-term borrowing costs mostly fell Monday as investors put more money into the Treasury market following a weak end to 2009.

title: Welcome Home, Wives
description: Whether or not youre willing to admit that you missed Desperate Housewives, ABC was grateful for the women of Wisteria Lane, as a new episode of that prime-time soap opera helped the network place second on Sunday night. NBC was first with Sunday Night Football; although Nielsens final audience figures were not immediately available, the preliminary overnight estimates for the New York Jets-Cincinnati Bengals game were higher than any other broadcast for the night but slightly lower than last weeks game, which averaged 19 million viewers. Desperate Housewives drew 15.2 million viewers for the night, and ABC was also lifted by new episodes of Extreme Makeover: Home Edition (11 million) and Brothers & Sisters (10.9 million). CBS was third with 60 Minutes (14.9 million), followed by reruns of NCIS and Cold Case. Fox was fourth with its animated comedy lineup, including The Simpsons (8.7 million) and Family Guy (8.1 million).

title: MF Global Moves Corporate Home to Delaware
description: MF Global, the futures and options broker, said Monday it has changed its corporate domicile to Delaware from Bermuda.

title: China May Allow Futures Contracts in March
description: Chinas securities regulator may introduce futures contracts on the countrys stock indexes as early as March, an official with knowledge of the matter told Bloomberg News.

title: Japan Airlines Shares Jump as More Aid Is Sought
description: Japan Airlines shares jumped more than 30 percent Monday as the government looked to secure funds to prevent the carrier from running out of cash as it awaited a possible bailout.

title: Not Guilty Plea in Philippines Massacre
description: MANILA  A mayor in the southern Philippines accused in the November massacre of dozens of people  the worst act of political violence in the countrys history  pleaded not guilty to 41 charges of murder at the opening of his trial on Tuesday.

title: Messting
description: Text messages that could mess up your life.

title: Biogen Chief and Icahn Adversary to Retire
description: Carl C. Icahn may be pleased to learn that one of his adversaries, James C. Mullen, the chief executive of Biogen Idec, is retiring as president and chief executive of the company as of June 8.

title: Manufacturing Data Helps Invigorate Wall Street
description: Wall Street ushered in 2010 on Monday with its biggest stock market rally in nearly two months, as signs that manufacturing was strengthening around the world fed hopes that the economy would recover this year.

title: Dodging the Dollar at Overseas Meetings
description: Although it has ticked up a bit recently, the United States dollar did not have a particularly good 2009. Nor was its value against competing currencies like the euro and Japanese yen easy to predict.

title: Tax Enforcers Intensify Focus on Multinationals
description: While the recession may be ending across much of the world, its effect on revenue collectors and corporate tax returns will last much longer.

title: TV Venture Gives Skype a Boost
description: There will soon be something new to watch on the living room TV: your relatives and friends in different parts of the world.

title: Premier Takes 50 Percent Stake in North Sea Block
description: Premier Oil said it would take a 50 percent interest and assume operatorship of Block 22/19c in the Central North Sea after reaching an agreement with Serica Energy, Reuters reported.

title: BofA Chief Disagrees With Calls for Bank Breakups
description: The chief executive of Bank of America, Brian Moynihan, said the financial industry needed to embrace a looming regulatory overhaul instead of fight it, but added that breaking up the biggest United States banks would be a mistake.

title: Alcon Directors Criticize Novartis Tactics
description: An independent committee of directors of Alcon is disappointed with a takeover bid from Novartis, saying Novartis, the Swiss drug maker, is trying to circumvent protections for minority shareholders.

title: S.E.C. Names Head of Inspections Office
description: A partner in PricewaterhouseCoopers, the big accounting firm, has been named to head a crucial division of the Securities and Exchange Commission, which was blamed for contributing to the breakdown that allowed Bernard L. Madoffs multibillion-dollar fraud to go undetected for 16 years, The Associated Press reported.

title: India Tightens Tourist Visa Rules
description: The Indian government recently announced that foreigners holding tourist visas, including ones with multiple entries, are now banned from re-entering the country within two months of their departure.

title: Securities Suits Decline as Credit Crisis Fades
description: Securities-fraud class-action lawsuits fell 24 percent in 2009 as litigation related to the credit crisis, and especially subprime mortgage losses, began to dry up, according to a study, Bloomberg News reported.

title: The Nifty 50 | Boyd Holbrook, Artist/Actor/Filmmaker
description: This month, T celebrates the Nifty 50: Americas up-and-coming talent.

title: With Canadian Oil Merger, Prices Heat Up
description: PetroBakken Energy said Monday that it had paid $262 million to buy Berens Energy, a company that has drilled just three wells on its oil lands, The Globe and Mail reported.

title: How Safe Is a World Without the Bomb?
description: Todays idea: Why should we expect a world without nuclear weapons to be safer than one with them? Its time to think through the hair-trigger scenarios that nuclear abolition could bring about, says a Nobel-winning academic.

title: Bank Lobbying Abetted Mortgage Mess, I.M.F. Says
description: Large United States banks that lobbied heavily were more likely to practice risky lending, and see their shares perform relatively poorly, the International Monetary Fund said in a study.

title: Threats Lead Food Agency to Curtail Aid in Somalia
description: UNITED NATIONS  After weeks of receiving threats and demands that it dismiss many female employees and pay a security fee to an Islamic extremist group, the United Nations World Food Program announced Tuesday that it was suspending food deliveries to one million people in southern Somalia indefinitely.

description: Aviva said it had bought a fund manager in the United States for an undisclosed sum, in an effort to win more investment management business from institutional investors there, Reuters reported.

description: Rexchip Electronics, a memory-chip joint venture between Japans Elpida Memory and Taiwans Powerchip Semiconductor, is weighing an initial public offering in Taiwan this year, Dow Jones reported.

description: A report Monday that Goldman Sachs is considering moving some of its key departments in London overseas has sparked the citys mayor to call for a re-think on the U.K. governments plans to implement a bonus tax.

title: Are Bonuses Giving Manhattan Real Estate a Lift?
description: Is the return of the Wall Street bonus helping spur a comeback for Manhattan real estate prices? The suggestion by CNN Money, on the back of fourth-quarter figures that show that the 2009 Manhattan real estate market ended on a better note than it began.

description: Some hedge funds may find themselves in tight spot in 2010  not because of the markets, but because of one regulator who is setting his sights on wrongdoing in the industry.

description: Sell Saab! Thats the message of a group of Saab owners and enthusiasts who will gather, with their vehicles, at General Motors Renaissance Center headquarters in Detroit today for a last-ditch appeal to preserve the embattled brand.

title: Sampler: New Shuttle, New Bookstores, a New Way to Sign Petitions
description: Oakland Mayor Dellums Takes a Different Route | Oaklands Mayor Ron Dellums was not among the Californian mayors who signed a letter asking state leaders to move quickly in order to qualify for federal education financing. His advisers said Mayor Dellums respectfully declined, instead seeking specific support of amendments to the Race to the Top legislation such as a push for a diverse teaching corps. [The San Francisco Chronicle, The Sacramento Bee]

title: Japans Finance Minister Considers Quitting
description: TOKYO  Japans new government braced for another setback Tuesday after reports that its ailing 77-year-old finance minister was pressing to resign, although it appeared that the prime minister might try to persuade him to remain in his job. The news comes at a difficult time  when the government, already weakened by a series of policy blunders and scandals, is attempting the delicate task of stimulating an economy already burdened with enormous debt.

description: Berkshire Hathaway, the giant conglomerate run by Warren E. Buffett and Krafts largest shareholder, said on Tuesday that it had rejected the American food giants proposal to issue new shares to back up its $16 billion bid for Cadbury.

description: Updated, 5:55 p.m. | Jayson Williams, the former star with the New Jersey Nets, was arrested and charged with driving while intoxicated on Tuesday morning when the sport utility vehicle he was driving struck a tree in Manhattan, the police said.

title: Environmental Refugees Unable to Return Home
description: Mahe Noor left her village in southern Bangladesh after Cyclone Sidr flattened her familys home and small market in 2007. Jobless and homeless, she and her husband, Nizam Hawladar, moved to this crowded megalopolis, hoping that they might soon return home.

description: City Councilman Simcha Felder, a close ally of Mayor Michael R. Bloomberg who supported his campaign to revise term limits, plans to resign from the Council to work for the new comptroller, John C. Liu, according to a City Hall official with with direct knowledge of the situation.

description: Monologue |  Monday night on Late Night With Jimmy Fallon on NBC: Has everybody here seen Avatar? Great movie, wasnt it? Even President Obama took his family to see it at a private screening in Hawaii. After the movie, Obama was like, So thats what its like when something lives up to its hype.

description: NEWPORT BEACH, Calif.  Alabama quarterback Greg McElroy didnt move to Texas until he was 10.

description: Monologue |  Monday night on The Tonight Show With Conan OBrien on NBC: President Obama took his daughters to see the 3-D version of Avatar. There was an awkward moment when one of Obamas daughters leaned over to him and whispered, Now, thats how you spend half a billion dollars.

title: Holidays in Hawaii
description: Monologue |  Monday night on The Late Late Show With Craig Ferguson on CBS: Everyones back from vacation today. In Washington, President Obama returned to the Oval Office after spending the holidays in Hawaii. And Joe Biden returned after spending the holidays on his home planet.

title: Venture Reported for a 3-D TV Channel
description: On the Media Decoder blog, Brian Stelter of The Times reports that Discovery, Imax and Sony are forming a joint venture for a 3-D television channel. The venture is expected to be announced on Tuesday, timed to the Consumer Electronics Show in Las Vegas, where 3-D television is expected to be a hot topic. The project, described by two people with knowledge of the deal, has a start date of 2011.

title: We Dont Need It
description: Monologue |  Monday night on The Late Show With David Letterman on CBS: The global warming conference has been canceled. Right. We dont need it. You see, because its so damn cold.

description: Monologue |  Monday night on The Jay Leno Show on NBC: Good to see everybody. You know, it is good to be back. We were off for Christmas, and apparently so was the Department of Homeland Security.

description: With less than a month to go until the Feb. 2 premiere of the final season of Lost, ABC gave the shows promotional machine a first fateful crank on Monday evening, releasing two images designed to whet the appetites of longtime Lost fans.

title: Slowing Pace of Home Sales Raises Fears of New Retreat
description: The number of houses placed under contract fell sharply in November in the first drop in nearly a year, figures released Tuesday show. It was the clearest sign yet that predictions of another downturn in real estate may become a reality.

title: Tuesday Reading
description: A wide variety of consumer-focused stories appears in various sections of The New York Times and online in our blogs. Each weekday morning, we gather them all up here so you can quickly scan the news that could hit your wallet.

title: The Best Values in Public Universities, as Handicapped by Kiplingers
description: Update | 9:14 a.m. Click here to read a comment from Jane B. Clark, the author of the Kiplinger Best Values article. In response to several comments submitted to The Choice, she provides some details of how the magazines survey is fashioned.

title: No Surprise: Cadillac CTS-V Coupe Set for Detroit
description: With the Detroit auto show just around the corner, General Motors released photos of the forthcoming Cadillac CTS-V Coupe, a supercharged version of the luxury coupe introduced a few weeks ago at the Los Angeles auto show.

title: The Producers Toss Some Wild Cards Into the Mix
description: The Producers Guild of America, which like the Academy of Motion Picture Arts and Sciences jacked up the number of best picture nominees to 10 this year, announced its picks Tuesday morning and the tea leaves are immediately being read across Hollywood. Its choices, which usually go mainstream, included the big studio releases Avatar, Up in the Air, Up, and Invictus, and the smaller fare including An Education, The Hurt Locker, Inglourious Basterds and Precious. Star Trek and District 9  two movies that picked up good reviews and good returns at the box office but are considered long shots for Oscar nominations  also made the cut.

title: Inside Out | Girly, Not Gooey
description: Rita Konig is a decorator based in New York who has written about style for British Vogue, The Telegraph and Domino.

title: Alexandra Raij Returns to El Quinto Pino
description: Alexandra Raij, who started the Chelsea tapas bars Tia Pol and El Quinto Pino with Heather Belz and Mani Dawes, then left to open the Basque restaurant Txikito with her husband, Eder Montero, will return to El Quinto Pino after the three women agreed to divide ownership of their restaurants.

title: Whats in a Naming Right? Certainly Not Cash
description: What shall we call the new stadium that will house the Jets and the Giants starting next season?

title: Fred McGriff and the Endorsement That Lives Forever
description: For years, Fred McGriff has been identified as Major League Super Star. Its a fitting kind of catchall for those fabulous commercials McGriff does for Tom Emanskis Defensive Drills video, a staple of ESPN for so many years.

title: Avatar Commandeers Film Piracy Record
description: As Avatar knocks down box office records with each day of its theatrical release, the film has hit another, less estimable milestone: It has become the fastest-pirated movie yet, according to one tracking firms figures. The Times of London reported that Avatar was illegally downloaded 500,000 times in its first two days of release and 980,000 times in its first week, according to the Web site TorrentFreak.com, which tracks usage of the file-sharing tool BitTorrent.

title: Panther Fill-In
description: Directions: Fill in the blanks in the first four paragraphs of this article from the Science Times, A Puddy Tat, but Watch Out for That Bite.  Use your own words, or click read more to choose from a scrambled list of the words that were removed.

title: Name This Stadium
description: In an article posted Tuesday, Richard Sandomir writes about the search for a sponsor at the Meadowlands new stadium:

title: Avatars Virtual Appeal
description: The much-discussed irony of James Camerons Avatar (which has already grossed upwards of a billion dollars worldwide) is that its a celebration of primitivism, pantheism, and pre-modernity created with the most cutting-edge technological tools a modern capitalist society can muster. But Caleb Crain, in a provocative post, suggests that this isnt an irony at all. The apparent contradiction inherent in a CGI-created blockbuster that celebrates back-to-nature tribalism can be resolved, he argues, once you realize that the audience inevitably experiences the movies primitive world as a Matrix-style simulation of nature, rather than the real thing  as an escape from technology, that is, that only technology can make possible:

title: Spooning Up the Wrong Dose
description: Many people still use kitchen spoons to measure a dose of liquid medication. Now new research shows that the size of the spoon influences our ability to estimate the right dose  and most of the time, we get it wrong.

title: What to Watch Tuesday: Midget Submarines and George Lucas
description: History buffs, especially those with an interest in warfare, will want to put PBSs Nova series on their must-see list for Tuesday night (check local listings). The program goes beneath the waves at Pearl Harbor to investigate the possible role of Japans midget submarines in the attack of Dec. 7, 1941. It looks specifically at the battleship Arizona, which was sunk that day with a loss of 1,177 lives. For decades, it has been thought that a bomb dropped by a Japanese aircraft sank the Arizona, the programs publicity says. But the discovery of a group of Japanese midget subs in and around Pearl Harbor has raised questions about the battleships final hours.

title: Testing Infomercial Claims
description: It turns out the Snuggie may not be the perfect blanket after all.

title: No Longer Majority Black, Harlem Is in Transition
description: For nearly a century, Harlem has been synonymous with black urban America. Given its magnetic and growing appeal to younger black professionals and its historic residential enclaves and cultural institutions, the neighborhoods reputation as the capital of black America seems unlikely to change soon.

title: Frise Salad With Poached Egg
description: This is inspired by a classic French country salad. The traditional dish includes thick-cut bacon, but this version is great without the meat. You can serve it as a starter, but I like to make a meal of it.

title: Woman Pleads Guilty to Stalking L.B.O. Billionaire
description: Thomas H. Lee, the billionaire and a pioneer of the private equity industry, can breathe a bit easier now that his longtime stalker has pleaded guilty, according to media reports.

title: Briatore and Symonds Win Their Case Against F.I.A.
description: Flavio Briatore, the former Renault team director, has won his legal case in a French court against the Fdration Internationale de lAutomobile and his lifetime ban from all motor-racing activities has been overturned by the court. Briatore was also awarded a $21,500 compensation, although he had asked for $1.45 million. Pat Symonds, the former Renault team technical director, also had his five-year ban overthrown. The two were accused of having organized a deliberated crash by one of their drivers to influence the outcome of their other driver at the Singapore Grand Prix of 2008.

title: Why Women Dont Get Enough Sleep
description: Over at the Huffington Post, Arianna Huffington has joined with the Glamour editor Cindi Leive to make a New Years resolution. They vow to get more sleep this year, and they urge the rest of us to follow their lead.

title: The Pregame Huddle: B.C.S. Title Game
description: There is little doubt who the top two teams in the nation are this season as Alabama and Texas prepare to play for the B.C.S. championship.

title: Las Vegas Orders Cover-Up of Topless Mural Figures
description: This post includes links to some PG-13 images and video that may not be suitable for viewing at your workplace.

title: Where Perfection Is Underrated
description: The hope in the air in Glendale, Ariz., was palpable, or maybe that was just pollen. But it seemed like everyone who hates the Bowl Championship Series (which means everyone, minus about 10 holdouts) desperately wanted the Fiesta Bowl to blow everyones doors off, to prove once and for all the B.C.S. is an evil cartel aligned against democracy and any college that pays its football coach less than $4 million a year. They wanted Boise State to score 77 points in spectacular fashion or Texas Christian to fill the universe with purple power.

title: Avatar Commandeers Film Piracy Record
description: As Avatar knocks down box office records with each day of its theatrical release, the film has hit another, less estimable milestone: It has become the fastest-pirated movie yet, according to one tracking firms figures. The Times of London reported that Avatar was illegally downloaded 500,000 times in its first two days of release and 980,000 times in its first week, according to the Web site TorrentFreak.com, which tracks usage of the file-sharing tool BitTorrent.

title: U.S. Reopens Its Embassy After Raids in Yemen
description: The United States reopened its embassy in Yemen on Tuesday, a day after Yemeni security forces killed two people suspected of being members of Al Qaeda and linked to the threats against several diplomatic outposts.

title: Apple Buys Quattro, a Mobile Ad Company
