title: Adventures of the Wolverine Leaker
description: The man who stole Wolverine opened the door to his Bronx apartment with a grunt, his thin frame hunched at the waist, an unlikely villain with a bad back and pajama pants. Im a scapegoat for this, said Gilberto Sanchez, 47, after flopping down at his desk  the crime scene  and dragging on a cigarette. Im gonna get crucified.

title: M.T.A. Cutbacks Spawn Protest in Bay Ridge
description: What were looking at on the Web today

title: Her Most Desperate Hour: Carrie Fisher Discusses The Star Wars Holiday Special
description: As you may recall, whenever we here at ArtsBeat talk about The Star Wars Holiday Special we get all tingly in our midi-chlorians. Not surprisingly, George Lucas and the rest of the cast of Star Wars would prefer to toss the special into the Sarlacc Pit. Or to the Rancor monster. Or into the Death Stars reactor shaft. You get the picture.

title: Disneys Top Production Exec Leaves the Studio
description: The top production executive at Walt Disney Studios, Oren Aviv, has resigned under pressure in the latest of a string of management overhauls at the struggling company, according to people with knowledge of the matter.

title: Skepticism Follows McGwires Tears
description: While the sporting world paused on Monday to absorb the You dont say! news that Mark McGwire took steroids (tomorrow: Earth revolves around Sun), McGwire accomplished something remarkable: he made us pause while slapping our foreheads in mock surprise and made us cock our heads sideways like confused dogs for his seriously parsed confession. Yes, he used steroids but only occasionally (days that ended in Y) and only for (ahem) health benefits. They had nothing to do with his ability to hit home runs into orbit or his Volkswagen-size forearms.

title: Is Refusing Bed Rest a Crime?
description: Arguments are under way today in the First District Court of Appeals in Tallahassee, Fla., in the case of Samantha Burton, who was confined to her bed by a judge earlier this year because she was at risk for a miscarriage.

title: Appeal Request by Dan Rather Is Turned Down
description: Dan Rathers request for an appeal in his lawsuit against CBS Corporation was turned down on Tuesday, marking an apparent end to the high-profile breach of contract case.

title: Artists Miffed Over Rothschild Foundations Missing Grant Money
description: The Judith Rothschild Foundation has been one of those small grant-making organizations that can make a big difference to art.

title: Redemptions Hit Hedge Funds in December
description: Investor allocations to hedge funds reversed in December for the first time since May, according to a preliminary analysis of the numbers by the data and research firm HedgeFund.net, raising concerns that investors are finding other places to put their money to work.

title: The Different Fraud Protections for Signatures and PINs
description: Last weeks New York Times article How Visa, Using Card Fees, Dominates a Market detailed the behind-the-scenes struggle between banks and retailers to encourage customers to sign when making debit card purchases or to punch in their PIN because of the higher fees that stores pay banks for signatures.

title: Pu-Pu? Yahoo!
description: Come summer you can take off your overalls, put on a Hawaiian shirt and check out the surf on Park Avenue South. Michael Stillman and Craig Koketsu, of Park Avenue Winter/Spring/Summer/Autumn and Quality Meats, will be opening Hurricane Club, a decisively inauthentic Polynesian spot.

title: From the People Who Brought You Pride and Prejudice and Zombies': Android Karenina
description: Literary hybrids of Jane Austen novels and zombie stories? Thats so last year. Quirk Books, which released the best-selling novels Pride and Prejudice and Zombies and Sense and Sensibility and Sea Monsters, has seen the future of the mashup novel, and it is Leo Tolstoy and robots. The publisher said on Tuesday in a news release that its next entry in its Quirk Classics series will be Android Karenina, an enhanced edition of the Tolstoy novel set in a dystopian world of robots, cyborgs, and interstellar space travel.

title: Looking for an Escape From the Frigid City Streets
description: The snow may be gone from the citys streets but the component-eating road salt and a bitter cold lingers, leaving many cyclists dreaming of warm breezes. But where to go to escape the chill? Should road warriors head inside for a long ride toward the wall on the trainer? Take up a winter sport like cross-country skiing (a favorite of Greg Lemond) or just hibernate on the couch with a bunch of cycling films for inspiration?

description: As the Baggers Los Angeles buddy Brooks Barnes reports on Tuesday, the race for the best animated film Oscar is unexpectedly lively this year. The presumptive winner, a Pixar film  in this case, the hit Up, about a grumpy old man and his lofty bucket list quest  is getting sudden competition from Fantastic Mr. Fox, Wes Andersons painstakingly made stop-motion adaptation of the Roald Dahl novel. Critics and industry veterans alike were impressed by Mr. Andersons facility with a medium new to him, Mr. Barnes writes:

title: Making the Documentary Cut
description: After coming out with its best director nominations last Thursday for best feature, the Directors Guild of America on Tuesday announced the nominees for best directing achievement in documentaries. (A category so sexy the Golden Globe doesnt even include it in its nominations.)

title: Poll: Obamas Ratings on Health Care, Economy Drop Lower
description: Fewer Americans now approve of the way that President Barack Obama is handling the economy and health care, pushing his overall job rating below the crucial 50 percent mark, according to the latest CBS News poll.
